name: Bigscreen Beta
description: Bigscreen lets you use your PC desktop in VR. Watch movies with friends in a virtual movie theater. Play your favorite PC video games on a huge screen. Hangout in social VR chat rooms. Participate in weekly 3D Movie Nights, VR LAN parties, and other events.
minimum_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel i5-4590 Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 970 / AMD 290 equivalent or greater DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 1500 MB available space
recommended_requirements: Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system OS: Windows 10 Memory: 16 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 1060 or greater Storage: 1500 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Highly recommendable!   It's a virtual LAN for you and your friends around the country/world whether they have an Oculus Rift or an HTC Vive!   Everyone get's their own customisable screen and there's a big screen up front if you want to share your screen with others in the room. Positional audio means it feels more natural when people speak - I look forward to the customisable avatars.  If you can set it to high quality then it does 1.5x rendering which looks better than Virtual Desktops standard rendering. My main display is 2560x1440 so everything I run is that resolution and with the 1.5x in BigScreen games and videos look really good.  I like the Virtual Appartment - in particular the balcony and living room but I'm not sure I'm a big fan of the space/planet environments.   So far it's been a smooth experience. I have loaded up a game (Fallout 4) on my screen while in multiplayer and it was flawless! Listening to people that joined my room was very clear and the positional audio helped know who was talking seeing as we all have one standard avatar at the moment.  I just wanted to say it's well worth getting - especially seeing as it's free :)  I have just noticed that the screen and room/environment settings aren't saved when you exit. It would be nice if they were as once you get your optimal/desired size/curve it would be nice to keep it  Also currently you can't share desktop audio... hopefully that will be implemented very soon.

This is with over 130 hours my most used VR application by far and I haven't even tried the multiplayer option yet. It's great as a monitor replacement and the beta features are helpful for playing the 3D movies that I can't play in Whirligig (only useful for regular SBS or OU - not 180° or 360°). In case devs are reading this I have one improvement request: Please add brightness settings. It would be helpful to reduce the overall brightness when reading or browsing the net since white backgrounds are just too bright after a while. If possible however implement a filter that dampens the brightness in a nonlinear fashion (darkening bright areas much more drastically then already dark areas).
This is the killer VR app you've been waiting for. Hang out, collaborate, or just watch movies with friends across the world.
I have not played multiplayer yet. Just the recently added support for 3D SBS and 3D OU is worth trying it out.

A brilliant tool that allows you to experience your desktop in VR to play any game on a big screen. The customizability allows you to change the distance and screen size along with the option to have a flat or curved screen.The only issue that I have with it is that I have to blindly reach for my mouse or keyboard when I let go.
Although the Vive does provide a desktop mode, this game does a much better job of it. Definitely worth the $0.00 (Not to mention the storage space).

Great! The virtual desktop works really well, and there is something amazing about just hanging out with people chatting while watching movies or playing games.

TL:DR - The coolest VR app I've ever experienced.   I spent 45 minutes hanging out with complete strangers in a virtual environment and felt completely comfortable, and walked away feeling like I had new friends. Such a cool way to share a VR experience with other people. Most impressed by the ability to sit in a big home theater and watch one person stream a video. Once they get the audio stream working, this is going to be such a huge time sink for me! I can't wait to hang out with friends across the world and play games, watch videos, collaborate on projects, have meetings, you name it! This is fantastic. If you have a VR headset, you owe it to yourself to get in this and try it.
